page.title: 08HAWBUSH COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: Local demand for a community centre resulted in a public meeting being called in 1954 under the chairmanship of Mr.Stan Hill, then chairman of {Brierley Hill}Council. At the meeting it was resolved to go ahead with the formation of a Community Association. This year the{Hawbush Community {Centre}celebrates its 21st anniversary in the new purpose built accommodation erected in 1964. The Association today is thriving, being fully booked for its public sessions. It boasts a main hall which includes a stage, together with smaller side rooms and it is licensed for alcohol, music and dancing. The centre is administered by a part time clerical assistant paid by {Dudley}Council, and has a President, a Chairman, a Vice-Chairman and a Treasurer.
